intro: Amsinckia cristata, commonly known as the mountain tobacco or crested sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its distinctive crested appearance comes from the elongated, wavy lobes of its leaves. Amsinckia cristata is known for its yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months.
